lead_paragraph: MURPHY--Hon. Francis T.,died peacefully on January 27, 2016 at the age of 88 surrounded by his family. He was married to his beloved Sheila Theresa for 55 wonderful years before her death on September 28, 2014. He is survived by their five children, Timothy F. Murphy and his wife, Pamela; Eileen and her husband, Jeffrey Forsyth; Kathleen and her husband, Lance Scott; Sheila and her husband, Michael Sproule; Annemarie and her husband, Kevin Casey; and his sister Irene McInerney. He was a loving grandfather to Casey, Kaitlyn, Timothy, Matthew, Sean, Patrick, Michael, Brendan, Megan and Liam. After being honorably discharged from the U.S. Navy after World War II, he graduated from Fordham University and New York Law School. A member of the New York judiciary for 40 years, he served 15 years as a trial judge and 25 years as a Justice of the Appellate Division First Department, with the last 20 years as the Court's Presiding Justice. When he left the Court, he joined the New York law firm of Kelley, Drye and Warren as Of Counsel. Throughout his career Judge Murphy was an ardent supporter of providing full legal services and justice to the underprivileged and incarcerated. A gracious man with a generous heart and strong religious beliefs, he took counsel only from his own conscience. The loves of Tim's life were his wife, Sheila, his family, his friends and his life in the law. Friends may call on Sunday, January, 31 from 2 to 4pm and 6 to 8pm at Graham Funeral Home, 1036 Boston Post Road, Rye, NY. Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated at Our Lady of Perpetual Help, 575 Fowler Avenue, Pelham Manor, NY on Monday, February 1 at 10am. Interment at St. Raymond's Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made in Judge Murphy's name to The Province of St. Mary (for the work of the Capuchin Franciscan Friars) at 210 West 31st Street, New York, NY 10001 or donate online at: www.capuchin.org 1/3
